tool.name: Primer.design
tool.description: identify sequence fragments that are specific to particular OTUs
tool.command:
echo 'primer.design( fasta=$fasta, list=$otu, #if $label: label=$label, #end if otulabel=$otulabel, #if $name: name=$name, #end if #if $count: count=$count, #end if #if $cutoff: cutoff=$cutoff, #end if #if $mintm: mintm=$mintm, #end if #if $maxtm: maxtm=$maxtm, #end if pdiffs=$pdiffs, length=$length, processors='\${GALAXY_SLOTS:-8}' )' | sed 's/ //g' ## mothur trips over whitespace | mothur &&
## move output files to correct destination prefix="$otu" && mv \${prefix%.dat}*.cons.fasta "$fasta_out" && mv \${prefix%.dat}*.primer.summary "$summary_out" && mv \${prefix%.dat}*.pick.* "$list_out" && mv mothur.*.logfile "$logfile"

param.name: label
param.label: label - OTU Labels
param.help: If none selected, the first label in your file will be used

param.name: name
param.label: name - names file associated with your fasta file

param.name: count
param.label: count - a count table associated with your fasta file

param.name: pdiffs
param.label: pdiffs - specify the number of differences allowed in the primer

param.name: length
param.label: length - indicate the length of the primer

param.name: cutoff
param.label: cutoff - set a percentage of sequences that support the base
param.help: For example: cutoff=97 would only return a sequence that only showed ambiguities for bases that were not supported by at least 97% of sequences.

tool.help:
@MOTHUR_OVERVIEW@
**Command Documenation**
The primer.design_ allows you to identify sequence fragments that are specific to particular OTUs.
.. _primer.design: http://www.mothur.org/wiki/Primer.design
